Race Resume

idea from Lindsay at Chasing the Kenyans

Objective

I have a long term goal to run a marathon in all 50 states. As of June 2019, I have completed 21 states.

For several years, I had an objective to qualify for the New York City Marathon, but I qualified in Oct 2011. After two years of mishaps, I ran it in November 2014.

I’d like to break 3 hours in the marathon, but I had knee surgery several months after my 3:09:52 PR in 2012 and haven’t gotten anywhere near that since.

I am Marathon Maniac #194

Current PRs

1m: 5:24/5:24* (2012)
5k: 19:49/6:23 (2012)
4m: 28:52/7:14 (2008)
5m: 35:05/7:01 (2011)
10k: 41:23/6:40 (2011)
10M: 1:10:06/7:00 (2012)
13.1m: 1:29:50/6:52 (2013)
26.2m: 3:09:52/7:15 (2012)
50k: 6:15:49/12:26 (2008)

2019

Marathons run:

  • Ottawa Race Weekend
  • Grandma’s Marathon

2018

Marathons run:

  • Mesa-Phx Marathon
  • Boston Marathon
  • Marine Corps Marathon

Race highlights:

  • Paced Mom to break five hours in the Mesa-Phx marathon!

###

2017

Marathons run:

  • Maui Oceanfront Marathon
  • Harmon Lake Trail Marathon
  • Jack and Jill Downhill Marathon
  • Tahoe Triple: Lake Tahoe Marathon, Cal-Neva Marathon, Lakeside Marathon

Race highlights:

  • Completed the Tahoe Triple!
  • First Masters Female in the Tahoe Triple
  • First woman overall at the Lake Tahoe Marathon
  • First woman overall at the Harmon Lake Trail Marathon
  • Post-surgery PR (and 2nd fastest marathon ever) of 3:29:13 at Jack and Jill Downhill Marathon

2016

Marathons run:

  • Eugene Marathon
  • Marathon du Medoc

2015

Marathons run:

  • Rock and Roll Arizona
  • Deadwood-Michelson Trail Marathon

2014

Marathons run:

  • Pikes Peak
  • New York City Marathon

2013

Race highlights:

  • Broke the 90 minute barrier in the RnRAZ ’13 Half Marathon

2012

Marathons run:

  • Houston Marathon
  • Pikes Peak Marathon
  • Leadville Trail Marathon

Race highlights:

  • Set a huge (20min) PR at the Houston Marathon, running sub-3:10.
  • PRed in the Arnold Pump and Run 5K (after bench-pressing 80lbs 23 times)!
  • PRed at the Platte River Half
  • PRed at the Cherry Creek Sneak 10M (granted, I hadn’t run a 10 Miler since 2006)
  • PRed* at the Superior Downhill Mile, 5 days after running a marathon

2011

Marathons run:

  • Pikes Peak

Race highlights:

  • Set a 5K PR at the Valentine’s Day PR (coming off injury)
  • A week later, set a 5 mile PR at the Snowman Stampede
  • A week after that, set a PR at the Fight for Air Stair Climb
  • Set a 10K PR at the Bolder Boulder and then improved further on it at the Mesa Turkey Trot 6 months later
  • Set a half marathon PR at the Slacker Half-Marathon
  • Participated in the Epic Rocky Mountain Relay
  • Set a one mile PR – and didn’t hate running it! At the Metro Mile.
  • Doubled Pikes Peak (ran the Ascent Saturday and the Marathon Sunday)
  • Placed 2nd in my age group, and ran sub-6 hours in the Pikes Peak marathon
  • A week later, placed first in my age group in the Pikes Peak Road Ascent (and became one of only a handful of “triplers” of the Pikes Peak races)
  • Qualified for the New York City Marathon and set a big PR at the Rock and Roll Denver Half

2010

Marathons Run:

  • Big Sur
  • Pikes Peak Marathon

Race highlights:

  • Set a big half marathon PR at the Rock and Roll Arizona Half Marathon
  • Participated in the Bourbon Chase relay

Race highlights:

  • Set a new marathon PR at the Rock and Roll Arizona Marathon
  • Placed first in my age group at the Last Chance for Boston Marathon
  • Ran with Mom through her first marathon
